title: Ticket #4266: Matchmaker should avoid matching startds about to leave a glidein
description:
Especially in a glidein pool setting, it is a waste of time for the negotiator to make matches to startds that are likely to shutdown before the schedd is able to claim it.

As the DaemonShutdown attribute is advertised in the machine classad, a simple patch could allow the negotiator to ignore ads that are going to go away soon.

The thinking is to accomplish this via a new negotiator knob, NEGOTIATOR_TRIM_SHUTDOWN_THRESHOLD, an expression evaluated to an integer value within the context of the negotiator classad, with a default value of 0. When this expression evaluates to an integer X, and X is greater than 0, the negotiator will not make matches to machine ads that contain a DaemonShutdown attribute that evalutes to true when attribute CurrentTime is set to be X seconds into the future.
remarks:
2014-Mar-18 13:32:07 by tannenba:
The assumption here is that DaemonShutdown contains logic like 

   Activity=="Unclaimed" && (CurrentTime - EnteredCurrentActivity >
GLIDEIN_Max_Idle)

Unfortunately this is not currently true of glideInWMS, which actually contains logic like 

   TotalTimeUnclaimedIdle > GLIDEIN_Max_Idle

which is incorrect as it will result in the startd shutting down once it has hit a total of 20 minutes of idle time across its entire lifetime, ie. perhaps the slot is continuously being used, but there is 5 minutes of idle time between jobs. After four jobs, the startd will shutdown, which is not the desired behavior.

Parag and I talked about this - I suggest that glideInWMS make the change above to reference CurrentTime, and then set NEGOTIATOR_TRIM_SHUTDOWN_THRESHOLD to whatever value Igor suggests. Note it could be set to be a function of the length of the previous negotiation cycle, which may have a nice self-limiting property.
